title: Anthropic accuses DeepSeek, other Chinese AI developers of 'industrial-scale' copying Claims 'distillation' included 24,000 fraudulent accounts and 16 million exchanges to train smaller models
summary: Anthropic accuses DeepSeek and other Chinese AI developers of 'industrial-scale' copying, using 24,000 fraudulent accounts and 16 million exchanges to train their models.
insight: Massive AI cheating exposes vulnerability in model development processes

title: Portable USB DVD writer with 2.5-inch SATA and SD card dock slashed by 30% to $21 optical drive can read and write CDs at 24X, and DVDs at 8X
summary: This portable USB DVD writer can read and write CDs and DVDs at high speeds, and also doubles as a 2.5-inch SATA and SD card dock, making it a versatile and affordable option for under $21.
insight: Portable optical drives still offer convenience and value in modern computing.

title: Intel preps CPUs with 'Unified Core' architecture job listing hints at evolution beyond Intel's hybrid design
summary: Intel is working on 'Unified Cores' CPUs, potentially replacing hybrid design.
insight: Intel's Unified Core CPUs may signal a major CPU architecture shift.

title: German data center giant hikes prices up to 37% starting April 1 Hetzner cites rising hardware costs for price increases
summary: Hetzner, a German data center operator, is raising prices up to 37% across its products starting April 1, citing rising hardware costs.
insight: Increasing cloud and data center prices impact businesses and consumers worldwide.

title: Linux 7.0 launches with enablement for Intel Nova Lake, AMD Zen 6 major kernel update expected in Ubuntu 26.04 LTS and Fedora 44 first
summary: Linux 7.0 has been released with support for Intel's Nova Lake and AMD's Zen 6. This kernel update will eventually be integrated into various Linux distributions. It marks a significant step forward in hardware compatibility.
insight: Upgrades enable support for latest Intel and AMD processor generations.

title: Lenovo and Asus handheld owners warned as Ryzen Z1 Extreme driver support reportedly ends lack of official updates threatens longevity for Legion Go, Go S, and ROG Ally X devices on Windows 11
summary: AMD has reportedly stopped delivering new driver updates for Ryzen Z1 Extreme handheld gaming PCs. This affects devices like Lenovo Legion Go, Go S, and Asus ROG Ally X. Users may face issues with Windows 11 compatibility.
insight: End of driver support threatens handheld gaming PC longevity.

title: Trump tariff turbulence risks handing TSMC a win over American chip manufacturers prior exemptions for onshoring manufacturing may hinder the likes of Intel
summary: Trump's tariffs may inadvertently help TSMC over American chip makers due to exemptions and rising costs.
insight: Rising material costs hinder US chip production, benefiting international competition.

title: Asus ROG Swift PG32UCDM3 240 Hz QD-OLED gaming monitor review: Asus delivers a true flagship OLED
summary: Asus delivers a 32-inch 4K OLED gaming monitor with 240 Hz refresh rate, Quantum Dot color technology, and advanced HDR support, setting a new standard for gaming displays.
insight: Innovative OLED gaming monitors raise the bar for immersive gaming experiences.

title: MSI RTX 5090 Lightning Z GPUs listed on eBay for almost $27,000 limited edition graphics card demands 500% premium from resellers
summary: Resellers are listing MSI RTX 5090 Lightning Z GPUs on eBay at inflated prices, ranging from $6,700 to nearly $27,000. This is a significant markup from the card's original value. The limited edition graphics card is in high demand.
insight: Massive price gouging by resellers exploits limited supply and high demand.

title: Stargate AI data centers for OpenAI reportedly delayed by squabbles between partners sources say OpenAI, Oracle, and SoftBank disagreed on who would have ultimate control of the planned data centers
summary: OpenAI, Oracle, and SoftBank are reportedly at odds over control of Stargate data centers. The disagreement has delayed the project after several months of negotiations. The planned data centers are crucial for OpenAI's operations.
insight: Disagreement over control jeopardizes critical infrastructure for AI operations.

title: US exports from Taiwan now exceed exports from China for the first time in decades AI gold rush fuels 93.5% jump in advanced system exports
summary: Taiwan's exports to the US now exceed China's for the first time, while Taiwan's global exports are rapidly increasing, especially in advanced systems.
insight: Taiwan's trade surge highlights growing global economic influence shift.

title: Nintendo's Game & Watch hacked and turned into retro emulation beast Solder job unlocks device from its Zelda-only cage thanks to a custom SD card slot
summary: A Zelda-edition Game & Watch was hacked to run custom firmware, unlocking its full potential. The device now emulates various consoles, includes save states, and has a microSD card slot. This project showcases the creativity of retro gaming enthusiasts.
insight: Retro gaming innovation can breathe new life into classic hardware devices

title: User accidentally gains control of over 6,700 robot vacuums while tinkering with their own device to enable control with a PlayStation controller security flaw reveals floor plans and live video feeds
summary: An AI strategist's experiment to control his robot vacuum with a PlayStation controller inadvertently granted him control over 6,700 similar devices worldwide, revealing floor plans and live video feeds.
insight: Weak device security can lead to catastrophic unintended global control.

title: Inkplate 13SPECTRA 13.3-inch E-ink Spectra smart color display supports Arduino, MicroPython, ESPHome (Crowdfunding)
summary: Soldered Electronics has released the Inkplate 13SPECTRA, a 13.3-inch E-Ink Spectra display based on ESP32-S3 WiFi and Bluetooth SoC. It features a microSD card slot, USB-C port, and expansion capabilities through Qwiic connectors and GPIO expander pins. The device supports Arduino, MicroPython, and ESPHome.
insight: First 13.3-inch E-Ink display with ESP32-S3 SoC for IoT applications

title: GyroidOS virtualization solution aims to secure embedded devices, ease cybersecurity certification
summary: GyroidOS is an open-source, multi-arch OS-level virtualization solution for embedded devices with hardware security features, aiming to support security certification processes like Common Criteria and IEC-62443 standards. It offers a smaller footprint and additional separation of privileged instances compared to other container solutions like Docker. GyroidOS provides several security features to ensure the isolation and protection of guest operating system stacks.
insight: Enhanced security for embedded devices through modular OS virtualization

title: Silex SX-SDMAX6E tri-band Wi-Fi 6E + Bluetooth LE module features NXP IW623 SoC, comes in M.2 or LGA package
summary: Silex Technology and NXP have partnered to launch the SX-SDMAX6E module, a tri-band Wi-Fi 6E and Bluetooth LE module based on NXP's IW623 SoC, available in M.2 or LGA package, supporting various applications in harsh environments.
insight: Tri-band Wi-Fi 6E supports high-throughput and low-power connectivity options

title: Announcing the second group of Rising Stars 2026
summary: The Fierce Sensors Rising Stars program recognizes individuals leading innovation in electronics. Additional honorees will be announced each week. This series showcases experts shaping technology's future.
insight: Innovators are driving electronics advancements for a better future today.

title: After $30 billion in school tech, the laptop classroom experiment may have backfired
summary: Maine's laptop classroom experiment, launched in 2002, aimed to boost education with tech. However, the $30 billion investment may have had unintended consequences. The program's effectiveness is now being questioned.
insight: Massive investment in tech may not guarantee student learning outcomes.

title: Dell, Lenovo, and others will launch Copilot+ laptops with Nvidia Arm CPU in H1 2026
summary: Nvidia is collaborating with MediaTek to develop new PC SoCs, and major PC manufacturers like Dell and Lenovo are working on laptops powered by these processors, which integrate CPU, GPU, and NPU components into a single chip.
insight: Nvidia's Arm CPU integration revolutionizes laptop design with unified processing.

title: Microsoft is adding images to Notepad, and users are wondering why
summary: Microsoft is reportedly adding image support to Notepad for users.
insight: Microsoft expands Notepad's functionality to cater to modern document needs.

title: UK data hoarder flies to America to buy hard drives, saves $2,000
summary: A UK resident saved $2,000 by buying replacement hard drives in the US.
insight: Price disparities across countries can lead to significant cost savings.

title: Tofu brine could power safer batteries that last decades, researchers say
summary: Researchers have created a safer battery design using tofu brine as the electrolyte, achieving over 120,000 charge cycles in lab tests. This far exceeds commercial standards, making it a promising innovation for electric vehicles. The design replaces complex, flammable lithium-ion chemistry with a safer alternative.
insight: Safer, longer-lasting batteries could transform electric vehicle technology.

title: Colorado bill could criminalize possessing 3D gun files, not just printing them
summary: Colorado bill HB26-1144 expands firearms rules to cover 3D printing, including possessing files.
insight: Possessing 3D gun files could become a serious crime in Colorado.

title: The Interim Computer Museum puts 28 classic computer systems on the internet for you to try
summary: The Interim Computer Museum has made 28 vintage computing systems accessible online. This includes emulated, partially hardware-based, and original machines. The public can now try these classic systems through a web portal.
insight: Preserving computing history for future generations and education purposes

title: MIT's new 3D printer can create a working electric motor in one go
summary: MIT researchers have created a 3D printer that can print a working electric motor in a single step, demonstrating its ability to fabricate complex devices.
insight: Single-step 3D printing simplifies complex device fabrication significantly.

title: Lab-grown brain tissue successfully solves a classic AI training problem
summary: Lab-grown brain tissue has successfully solved a classic AI training problem by stabilizing a simulated pole, demonstrating the potential of biological systems in complex tasks.
insight: Biological tissue can rival AI algorithms in complex problem-solving capabilities.

title: Sam Altman compares AI energy use to the cost of "training" humans, says water-usage concerns are "fake"
summary: Sam Altman compares AI's energy use to training human costs, dismissing water concerns.
insight: AI's environmental impact is comparable to human resource consumption.

title: 11 Need-To-Know Tools in Microsoft PowerToys
summary: Microsoft PowerToys offers a range of useful utilities to enhance productivity. This article highlights 11 essential tools worth using, saving users time and effort. From keyboard shortcuts to file management, these tools cater to various needs.
insight: Streamline workflow with Microsoft PowerToys' versatile productivity tools
